,,, 5GHz RF Power Amplifier Module;RFMD;RFPA5542;;4; ,,, 2-port USB 3.0 PCIe Controller;ASMedia;ASM1024A;;1; ,,, 1x2 PCIe Packet Switch;ASMedia;ASM1182e;;1; |802dot11_protocols = abgn+ac+ad |defaulip = |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = password |defaultssid = NETGEARXX |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = |manuf = |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 06/23/2017 |estreldate = 08/16/2017 |reldate = |estprice = 380 |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B078BP613M |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = 316 mm x 264 mm x 61 mm |weight = 1680 g |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Qualcomm Atheros;QCA9984; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = MHF4 |rad1txchains = 4 |rad1rxchains = 4 |rad1sstreams = 4 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |nqam1 = |rad1n = 600 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Qualcomm Atheros;QCA9984; |rad2oui = |rad2_ant_conn = MHF4 |rad2txchains = 4 |rad2rxchains = 4 |rad2sstreams = 4 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |rad2ac = 1733 |rad2n = 600 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 5 |rad3mod = Qualcomm Atheros QCA9008-SBD1 |rad3modif = M.2 (1216) |rad3chip1 = Qualcomm Atheros;QCA9500; |rad3oui = |rad3_ant_conn = MHF4 |rad3txchains = 1 |rad3rxchains = 1 |rad3sstreams = 1 |rad3stand = IEEE 802.11ad |rad3ad = 4620 |rad3freq = 60 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== :''802.11ac Quad-Stream Wave2 Wi-Fi plus 802.11ad'' A new FCC entry (PY317400405) suggests that Netgear has removed Bluetooth :circuitry and antenna in more recently manufactured devices. See the [https://fccid.io/PY317400405/Letter/Expedited-Review-Letter-3771555 Expedited Review letter]. Most of the information on this page was copied from the [[Netgear R9000]] since the FCC ID is the same.
This router appears to be a feature-limited R9000 [[List of Costco Exclusive Wireless Devices|exclusively for Costco]] like the [[Netgear AC1450]] was.
The only obvious change from the R9000 to this R8900 is the lack of non-standard 256-QAM support :for 2.4GHz 802.11n which reduces the maximum theoretical speed from 800Mbps to 600 Mbps. *[https://www.costco.com/NETGEAR-Nighthawk-X10-AD7000-MU-MIMO-Smart-Wi-Fi-Router.product.100369511.html ''Netgear Nighthawk X10 AD7000 MU-MIMO Smart Wi-Fi Router'' on '''Costco'''] {{see also|Netgear R9000|Netgear|Annapurna Labs}} ==Product features== *X10 is industryâ€™s fasted router for media streaming with Plex media server. *X10 with 802.11ac/ad Wi-Fi technology delivers ultra-smooth 4K streaming, :VR gaming and instant downloads. *With a powerful 1.7 GHz Quad-core processor, 60 GHz 11ad, and Quad-stream :architecture, you can enjoy combined wireless speeds of up to 7 Gbps. *MU-MIMO supports simultaneous streaming, while 160 MHz doubles :WiFi speeds to mobile devices. *Four patent pending external active antennas amplify WiFi signals :to maximize range and throughput. ==Specifications== *CPU: [[Annapurna Labs]] Alpine [https://community.arm.com/processors/b/blog/posts/synology-s-ds2015xs-brings-arm-to-high-performance-nas-units AL-514] @1.7 GHz :Quad Core ARM Cortex-A15 (see also AL5140) *Memory: 512MB Flash (NAND) and 1GB RAM (DDR3) *Tri-Band: 60 GHz (4600Mbps), 5 GHz (1733Mbps), 2.4 GHz ''(600Mbps)'' :Supports 4x high-performance active antennas (like R8500) *WLAN: 2x [[Qualcomm Atheros]] QCA9984 4T4R 802.11abgn/ac :*2.4GHz Radio: [[Qualcomm Atheros]] QCA9984 4x4 MU-MIMO ::- [[Skyworks]] SE2623L 2.4GHz Power Amp (x4) :*5GHz Radio: [[Qualcomm Atheros]] QCA9984 4x4 MU-MIMO ::- [[RFMD]] ([[Qorvo]]) RFPA5542 5GHz Power Amp (x4) :*60GHz Radio: [[Qualcomm Atheros]] QCA9500 1x1 (AD4600) ::- [[Qualcomm Atheros QCA9008-SBD1]] module *Seven (7x GbE) 10/100/1000 Mbps ports: 1x WAN & 6x LAN :LACP - Dual Gigabit Ethernet Port Aggregation (LAN1+LAN2) :*Switch: 2x [[Qualcomm Atheros]] QCA8337N (4x GbE) *Ports: 2x USB 3.0, 1x SFP+ LAN 10GbE (10Gbps) port *Dimension:: 316 mm x 264 mm x 61 mm (WxHxD) *Weight: 1680 g ==Links of Interest== ===Reviews=== *[https://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/33046-netgear-r9000-nighthawk-x10-smart-wifi-router-reviewed ''NETGEAR R9000 Nighthawk X10 Smart WiFi Router'' on '''SmallNetBuilder'''] :[[Annapurna Labs]] Alpine AL314 (?) @1.7GHz (Quad-core ARM Cortex A15) :''ASMedia'' ASM1182e 1x2 PCIe packet switch, QCA Bluetooth LE radio, :''ASMedia'' ASM1024A 2 port USB 3.0 PCIe controller ==See also== *[[List of 802.11ad Hardware]] *[[List of Four Stream Hardware]] [[Category:English Documentation]]
